DGACM.relevance_comment: Requests the Secretary‑General to ensure, as far as possible, that all requests for conference services for meetings of regional and other major groupings are met, and requests the Secretariat to inform requesters early about availability of conference services (including interpretation). This directs the Secretariat to perform conference‑servicing tasks that DGACM’s programme budget shows it implements (planning, scheduling, interpretation and client liaison).

Requests the Secretary‑General to continue to provide adequate information technology support for conference services, within the existing resources of the Department, to ensure seamless operation during the capital master plan. Directly concerns IT support for conference services — a core DGACM responsibility (e.g., e‑deleGATE, gDoc, gMeets) described in the PPB.

Requests the Secretary‑General to continue to provide adequate support, within existing Department resources, to ensure maintenance of the Department’s IT facilities, implementation of the global IT initiative and delivery of high‑quality conference services. This is a direction to the Secretariat regarding functions DGACM performs (systems operation, maintenance and service continuity).

Welcomes measures to ensure access to and use of conference services for persons with disabilities (Accessibility Centre) and encourages the Secretary‑General to continue efforts and report. DGACM implements accessibility services (sign language, captioning, seating arrangements) as reflected in its PPB, so this mandates continuation/expansion of those Department functions.

Requests the Secretary‑General to continue to address accessibility of conference facilities as a priority and to report. This directs Secretariat action in an area DGACM implements (meeting accessibility services described in the PPB).

Requests the Secretary‑General to report on efforts to establish common performance indicators and single IT systems (gData, gDoc, gMeets, gText). These are DGACM‑managed integrated systems per the PPB; the paragraph directs action and reporting on systems DGACM implements.

Requests the Secretary‑General to complete internal reviews concerning accountability mechanisms and the delineation of responsibility between the Under‑Secretary‑General for General Assembly and Conference Management and the Directors‑General at Geneva, Nairobi and Vienna, and to report. This mandates the Secretariat to clarify management arrangements directly affecting DGACM’s governance and operations.

Requests the Secretary‑General to continue to seek ways to promote workload‑sharing among the four main duty stations and to report. Workload‑sharing of documentation and interpretation is a central DGACM function (reflected in the PPB), so this directs action in an area DGACM implements.

Requests the Secretary‑General to develop recruitment, subcontracting and outreach policies to take account of imbalances in the pool of language professionals and to report. DGACM’s PPB shows it leads recruitment, subcontracting and outreach for language services; this instructs the Secretariat to adopt policies that DGACM will implement.

Requests the Secretary‑General to ensure that all language services are given equal treatment and provided with equally favourable working conditions and resources. This directly concerns the language services DGACM is responsible for and mandates Secretariat action to secure equitable treatment and resources for those Department functions.

Requests the Secretary‑General to ensure compatibility of technologies used in all duty stations and that they are user‑friendly in all official languages. DGACM manages conference and documentation technologies (gDoc, gMeets, etc.); this directs the Secretariat to achieve technical harmonization that DGACM implements.

Requests the Secretary‑General to include information on the operation, maintenance and harmonization of conference management software (gData, gDoc, gMeets, gText) in the proposed programme budget. These systems are DGACM responsibilities in the PPB; the paragraph requires Secretariat reporting and resourcing for systems DGACM operates.

Requests the Secretary‑General to report on updates (cost‑benefit, quality preservation/control) of the experimental statistical machine translation system (Tapta4UN). DGACM leads translation and technology initiatives per its PPB; this mandates reporting on a tool DGACM would be implementing or overseeing.

Requests the Secretary‑General to continue to ensure that measures taken by the Department to seek Member State evaluation of conference services provide equal opportunities in all six official languages and to report through the Committee on Conferences. This explicitly names the Department and directs action on client satisfaction processes DGACM conducts.

Requests the Secretary‑General to continue to explore best practices and techniques in client satisfaction evaluations and to report regularly. DGACM is responsible for conference‑service client evaluation in its PPB; this directs the Secretariat to pursue and report on evaluation methods that DGACM implements.

Requests the Secretary‑General to intensify exploration of innovative ways to systematically capture and analyse feedback from Member States and chairs/secretaries on conference service quality, and to report through the Committee on Conferences. DGACM conducts these evaluations; the paragraph mandates further action and reporting in that area.

Requests the Secretary‑General to continue to seek evaluation by Member States of conference services, including through language‑specific informational meetings (not to exceed two per year), ensuring equal opportunities in six languages and compliance with resolutions. This directs Secretariat action for evaluation modalities that DGACM is tasked to run.

Requests the Secretary‑General to keep the General Assembly and the Committee on Conferences apprised of progress in achieving integrated global management and to provide up‑to‑date information on new initiatives under the Committee’s purview. Integrated global management is a DGACM remit; the paragraph requires reporting on initiatives DGACM implements.

Requests the Secretary‑General to provide in his next report information about financial savings achieved through implementation of integrated global management projects. DGACM implements the integrated projects (per the PPB); this paragraph mandates reporting on results of DGACM activities.

Requests the Secretary‑General to appoint the Under‑Secretary‑General for General Assembly and Conference Management as the Coordinator for Multilingualism responsible for Secretariat‑wide implementation of multilingualism. This explicitly assigns the Coordinator role to the DGACM head — a direct mandate tied to the Department’s PPB responsibilities on multilingualism.

Requests the Secretary‑General to ensure the support necessary for the Working Group on the Universal Periodic Review reports to be issued in all official languages in a timely manner and to report to the General Assembly. DGACM provides translation and documentation services; this instructs the Secretariat to provide support DGACM would deliver.

Reiterates the request that the Secretary‑General ensure strict respect for rules concerning simultaneous distribution of documents in all six official languages (printed copies and posting on Official Document System/UN website). DGACM is responsible for simultaneous issuance and document posting per the PPB; this is a clear direction affecting Department operations.

Urges the Secretary‑General to ensure the timely presentation of official documents to the Fifth Committee and to find a lasting and sustainable solution to late issuance, so as to guarantee intergovernmental process quality. Timely issuance of documents is a core DGACM mandate in the PPB; this paragraph directs Secretariat measures DGACM implements or supports.

Requests the Secretary‑General to include in senior managers’ compacts a new standard managerial indicator related to timely issuance of official documentation to intergovernmental bodies and General Assembly committees, and to report in the next progress report on accountability. This instructs Secretariat management arrangements tied to document timeliness — an outcome DGACM’s work directly affects and reports on.

Requests the Secretary‑General to include in each section of the proposed programme budget an expected accomplishment of the Secretariat related to timely submission of documentation needed for meetings of relevant intergovernmental bodies. This mandates budgetary/result reporting on document submission — directly connected to DGACM responsibilities for documentation and scheduling.

Reiterates request that the Secretary‑General enforce the slotting system more rigorously (e.g., via the interdepartmental task force on documentation) and to report, noting only 84% of author departments reached compliance. This directs Secretariat enforcement measures to improve document submission predictability — matters DGACM monitors and acts upon in its PPB.

Welcomes interactions between the Department for General Assembly and Conference Management and author departments on waiver management, and requests the Secretary‑General to ensure continuous efforts in this regard and to report. This explicitly names DGACM and directs continuation of interdepartmental processes DGACM chairs/implements.

Requests the Secretary‑General to hold competitive examinations for recruitment of language staff sufficiently in advance to fill vacancies and to inform the General Assembly of efforts. Recruitment of language staff is a DGACM function described in the PPB; this mandates Secretariat action that DGACM will operationalize.

Requests the Secretary‑General to enhance access to competitive examinations by bringing examination sites closer to applicants in all regions and to report on progress. This directs Secretariat recruitment measures for language services that DGACM undertakes.

Requests the Secretary‑General to continue to improve the quality of translation of documents into the six official languages, giving particular significance to accuracy. DGACM’s PPB shows responsibility for translation quality management; this paragraph mandates Secretariat action to enhance translation quality DGACM implements.

Stresses the need to ensure the highest possible quality of contractual and in‑house translation and requests the Secretary‑General to report on measures to be taken. This directs Secretariat steps on translation quality control — a function DGACM oversees in its documentation services.

Reiterates request that the Secretary‑General provide, at all duty stations, adequate staff at appropriate levels to ensure quality control for external translation, with due consideration of equal grade for equal work. This mandates Secretariat resourcing that DGACM would implement to secure translation quality across duty stations.

Requests the Secretary‑General to apply common standards for quality control of documents processed by external translators in all four duty stations, within existing resources, and to report. DGACM’s PPB includes quality assurance for translation; this directs Secretariat‑level standardization that DGACM would operationalize.

Requests the Secretary‑General to report on experience, lessons learned and best practices of main duty stations in performing quality control of contractual and in‑house translations, including staffing requirements. This requests reporting on activities DGACM conducts and manages in its documentation services.

Encourages the Secretary‑General to establish globally standardized performance indicators and costing models for a cost‑effective strategy for in‑house processing of documents and requests submission of such information to the General Assembly. DGACM manages performance indicators and costing for documentation (PPB); this paragraph mandates Secretariat action in areas DGACM administers.

Notes measures taken by the Secretary‑General to address replacement of retiring staff in language services and requests continuation/intensification of efforts, including strengthening cooperation with training institutions. DGACM’s PPB includes outreach and training for language capacity; this directs Secretariat and Department activities to replenish language staff.

Requests the Secretary‑General to use appropriate means to improve the internship programme (to avoid shortages and turnover in language career fields) and to partner with organizations that promote official languages. DGACM conducts outreach/traineeships per its PPB; this paragraph mandates expansion of those Department activities.

Welcomes existing memorandums of understanding between the Organization and universities to strengthen training of language professionals and requests the Secretary‑General to continue efforts to assess the appropriate number of MOUs. DGACM’s PPB documents engagement with universities (MOUs); this paragraph directs continuation/expansion of that DGACM work.

Requests the Secretary‑General to make further concerted efforts to promote outreach programmes (traineeships, internships), introduce innovative methods to increase awareness, partner with Member States and institutions, and to report. DGACM leads outreach and internships in the language services; this mandates Secretariat action DGACM implements.

Requests the Secretary‑General to ensure that the Department for General Assembly and Conference Management, in cooperation with the Office of Human Resources Management, continues its efforts to raise awareness among Member States about employment and internship opportunities in the language services and to report to the Assembly. This explicitly directs the Department (DGACM) to continue specific outreach and recruitment activities named in its PPB.

Requests the Secretary‑General to develop the traineeship initiative further, extend it to all duty stations and to report. DGACM runs traineeship programmes per its PPB; this paragraph mandates expansion of those Department initiatives.

Requests the Secretary‑General, through the Department, to improve and expand the list of universities having memorandums of understanding with the United Nations, ensuring inclusion of institutions in all geographical regions whenever possible. This explicitly directs action 'through the Department' (DGACM) on MOUs and outreach — activities described in the PPB.
